reviews.text: Rather pleasant in summer with old station building that in addition to the ticket office houses (somewhat unusually) a laundry where you can drop your washing off on the way to work. Shame the overhead wire system rather gets in the way if you want to admire the view and the platform canopy is no longer extant. Popular with commuters with large car park (usually very busy on weekdays). Small waiting shelters on both platforms with access to westbound trains via footbridge only.

reviews.author_name: ULTRA LOGIK LTD ALL THINGS HAULAGE
reviews.text: GREAT PARKING - QUICK HOP SKIP JUMP INTO LONDON - AND A CHEEKY UBER/CAB ALWAYS THERE FOR THE LAST TRAIN HOME
Easy access for train service into London, Fenchurch Street station.  Good access to paid parking.  Trains are clean and modern.

Good train service into London. Lots of parking. I use the station on a daily basis when there other options slightly closer.
Staff are very helpful. Need to be at the station by 8.30 if you want to be sure of getting a space!
Ok but station toilets locked at 5.30 on a Friday evening. Why are station toilets never open? What is the point in having them?
